column4: Any ideas on how to shutdown the computer when X is closed? Trying to make a thin foolproof install for my father, and when he exits X i want the computer to do a "shutdown -h now" automagically (i'm using pekwm)
Yeah, and preferrably without any user interaction
what problem are you trying to solve?
[WaZ] : I'm trying to make a foolproof surfstation for my father, it's on an ancient computer - thus gnome is out of the picture
[WaZ] : This far I'm running pekwm for him wich autoload firefox on start (and i'm also using mingetty to autologin and start x for him on boot)
you could use gdm without gnome
[WaZ] : Now I want the computer to halt when he exits X, without and user interaction
and set up Windowmaker or something
[WaZ] : yeah, if feels overkill to install 30megs of apps for an auto-shutdown...
[WaZ] : is it possible to "stack" commands in xinitrc or something?
